meanings.definition: To put in jeopardy or danger.
meanings.sent1: Running across the street without looking both ways is jeoparding your safety.
meanings.sent2: Leaving your valuables unattended can jeoparding them to theft.
meanings.sent3: By forgetting to bring an umbrella, I was jeoparding myself to getting soaked in the rain.
meanings.sent4: Not wearing a helmet while biking is like jeoparding your head to potential harm.
meanings.sent5: Ignoring warning signs is jeoparding your own well-being.

meanings.definition: To expose to loss or injury.
meanings.sent1: Leaving the window open can jeoparding your house to burglars.
meanings.sent2: Not wearing a seatbelt can jeoparding your safety in a car accident.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much junk food is jeoparding your health in the long run.
meanings.sent4: Procrastinating on important tasks is like jeoparding your success.
meanings.sent5: Sharing personal information online can jeoparding your privacy.
